definition: to have tea and refreshments/to have dimsum lunch (Cantonese)

sentences.english: In other parts of China, tea-drinking rules are different from that of gongfu tea.
sentences.chinese: 其實，大部分地區的飲茶習俗都與閩南的工夫茶不同。

sentences.english: Britain and China were drinking tea large country, there are tea culture phenomenon.
sentences.chinese: 中英兩國皆爲飲茶大國，都存在茶文化現象。

sentences.english: Some places tea tea as a kind of enjoyment of the arts to promote.
sentences.chinese: 有的地方把飲茶品茗作爲一種藝術享受來推廣。

sentences.english: According to the historical record, the custom of tea-drinking occurred in the Wesrern Han Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 據史料記載，西漢時期已經有了飲茶的習俗。

sentences.english: Objective To observe the radiological character of drinking brick-tea type fluorosis.
sentences.chinese: 目的觀察飲茶型氟骨症骨關節損害的放射學特點。

sentences.english: The company, too, must be small. For, "it is important in drinking tea that the guests be few."
sentences.chinese: 同時，喝茶的友伴也不可多，“因爲飲茶以客少爲貴。

sentences.english: The English drinks the tea shade to be to each their own, but the general love adds the milk in the tea soup.
sentences.chinese: 英國人飲茶濃淡各有所好，但一般愛在茶湯中加牛奶。

sentences.english: Jinchang and with men, drinking tea when the two table sit separately.
sentences.chinese: 金昌和帶男不和，飲茶時分開兩張桌坐着。

sentences.english: DrinkTeaThe excited effect that causes, it is the effect of theine.
sentences.chinese: 飲茶所引起的興奮作用，是咖啡鹼的功效。

sentences.english: Drinking tea or coffee was a common cure for heart-burn.
sentences.chinese: 飲茶或者喝咖啡則是治療燒心的普遍方法。

sentences.english: Objective To duplicate the animal model of drinking brick-tea type fluorosis.
sentences.chinese: 目的複製飲茶型氟中毒動物病理模型。

sentences.english: The Tang Dynasty tea-drinking marks a very important milestone in the Chinese tea history.
sentences.chinese: 唐代在中國飲茶文化發展史上，具有極重要地位。

sentences.english: Tracing back to the Tang Dynasty, tea-drinking tradition of ancient China eventually passed into Japan.
sentences.chinese: 早在我國唐代，國內流行的飲茶習俗就已經傳入日本。

sentences.english: He also had tea with Putin.
sentences.chinese: 胡錦濤還與普京一起飲茶。

sentences.english: I just like the tea in the Buddhist sense, when the share of tea to enjoy a leisurely mood.
sentences.chinese: 我只是喜歡茶中的禪味，享受飲茶時那份悠閒的心境。

sentences.english: Drinking tea can inebriate people in summer.
sentences.chinese: 夏季飲茶不當也會讓人有醉的感覺。

definition: to have a meal/to eat/to make a living
to maintain good health/to raise a child or animal/curing (of concrete etc)
to taste a small amount/to sample
to pay particular attention to/carefully selected for quality/tastefully chosen
to rise/to spring up/to burgeon/to be aroused/to come into vogue
